name: VSteamPowerShell{{tag}}
description: Azure DevOps pipeline extension to run VSTeam PowerShell scripts natively and cross-platform
author: Sebastian Sch√ºtze

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure DevOps Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Azure DevOps connection to run the scripts on the target environment. Create a new service connection to the Azure DevOps organization where you want to connect to.

inputs.name: FileOrInline
inputs.label: Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Type of the script: File Path or Inline PowerShell.

inputs.name: PowerShellInline
inputs.label: Inline VSTeam PowerShell
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Allows you to specify PowerShell containing VSTeam PowerShell cmdlets.

Check the [official documentation](https://methodsandpractices.github.io/vsteam-docs/) for command that can be used.

inputs.name: PowerShellFilePath
inputs.label: VSTeam PowerShell Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the PowerShell file containing the script to execute.

inputs.name: PsArguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Arguments passed to the PowerShell script. Either ordinal parameters or named parameters.

inputs.name: errorActionPreference
inputs.label: ErrorActionPreference
inputs.helpMarkDown: Prepends the line `$ErrorActionPreference='VALUE'` at the top of your script.

inputs.name: RequiredVersion
inputs.label: Required Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set the version that should be loaded. Use 'latest' to always load the newest version. Check github for the released versions: https://github.com/MethodsAndPractices/vsteam/releases

inputs.name: failOnStderr
inputs.label: Fail on Standard Error
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is true, this task will fail if any errors are written to the error pipeline, or if any data is written to the Standard Error stream. Otherwise the task will rely on the exit code to determine failure.

inputs.name: workingDirectory
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Working directory where the script is run.
